cards.name: Battle Hymn
cards.text: Add {R} for each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"A church is just wood and walls. A congregation is the faithful praising the angels."
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf

rulings.text: Battle Hymn uses the stack and can be responded to. The amount of mana you add to your mana pool is based on the number of creatures you control when Battle Hymn resolves.

cards.originalText: Add {R} to your mana pool for each creature you control.

cards.name: Bonfire of the Damned
cards.text:
Bonfire of the Damned deals X damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
Miracle {X}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

rulings.text: Bonfire of the Damned targets only the player. Creatures with shroud or hexproof that player controls will be dealt damage by Bonfire of the Damned if it resolves.
A mana cost of {X}{X} means that you pay twice X. If you want X to be 3, you pay {6}{R} to cast Bonfire of the Damned.

Bonfire of the Damned's converted mana cost is based on its mana cost of {X}{X}{R}, even if you're casting it for its miracle cost. For example, if you cast Bonfire of the Damned for its miracle cost and choose 4 for X, its converted mana cost is 9.
If the player is an illegal target when Bonfire of the Damned tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt to any permanent or player.

Preventing some or all of the damage dealt to the player won't affect the amount of damage dealt to each creature that player controls. The same is true for any effect that increases or decreases the amount of damage dealt to the player.

foreignNames.name: 忌むべき者のかがり火

cards.originalText:
Bonfire of the Damned deals X damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
Miracle {X}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Burn at the Stake
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, tap any number of untapped creatures you control.
Burn at the Stake deals damage to any target equal to three times the number of creatures tapped this way.

rulings.text: Players may not respond to the paying of costs. Once Burn at the Stake has been announced and put on the stack, no one can try to respond by tapping any creatures.
The amount of damage Burn at the Stake deals won't change if any creatures tapped to cast it become untapped or leave the battlefield before it resolves.
All creatures tapped this way become tapped at the same time.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Burn at the Stake, tap any number of untapped creatures you control.
Burn at the Stake deals damage to target creature or player equal to three times the number of creatures tapped this way.

cards.name: Dangerous Wager
cards.text: Discard your hand, then draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"C'mon friend, take a turn tossing the knucklebones. What've you got to lose?"
—Tobias, trader of Erdwal

rulings.text: If you have no cards in hand when Dangerous Wager resolves, you'll simply draw two cards.

cards.originalText: Discard your hand, then draw two cards.

cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor:
"To truly defeat a skaberen, you must destroy not the monster but the lab."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.name: Dual Casting
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{R}, {T}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy."
cards.flavor: Hours after the Helvault opened, his powers returned twice as strong as before.

rulings.text: The ability granted by Dual Casting can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell you control, not just one with targets.

The copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell being copied is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode(s). You can't choose different ones.
If the spell being copied has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if you sacrifice a 3/3 creature to cast Fling and then copy it with the ability granted by Dual Casting, the copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage to its target.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{R}, {T}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy."

cards.name: Falkenrath Exterminator
cards.text:
Whenever Falkenrath Exterminator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}{R}: Falkenrath Exterminator deals damage to target creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Falkenrath Exterminator.

foreignNames.name: ファルケンラスの駆除屋

cards.originalText:
Whenever Falkenrath Exterminator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}{R}: Falkenrath Exterminator deals damage to target creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Falkenrath Exterminator.

cards.name: Fervent Cathar
cards.text:
Haste
When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: "I'll put my sword down only to die. And I don't plan on doing that today."

rulings.text: The targeted creature can't block any creatures this turn. The effect doesn't merely restrict whether it can block Fervent Cathar.

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Gang of Devils
cards.text: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
cards.flavor:
"Well, how could I know they'd explode?"
—Gregel, township militia

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you put Gang of Devils's triggered ability on the stack, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. (In other words, as you put the ability on the stack, you choose whether to have it deal 3 damage to a single target, 2 damage to one target and 1 damage to another target, or 1 damage to each of three targets.)

cards.originalText: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Guise of Fire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 and attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor:
"Fire will eventually destroy a zombie, but a fiery zombie destroys a lot of other things first."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

rulings.text: The controller of the enchanted creature still decides which player or planeswalker the creature attacks.

If, during its controller's declare attackers step, the enchanted creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Hanweir Lancer
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Hanweir Lancer is paired with another creature, both creatures have first strike.
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Hanweir Lancer is paired with another creature, both creatures have first strike.

cards.name: Havengul Vampire
cards.text:
Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.
cards.flavor: "That slowly decreasing pulse—that's the beat I waltz to."

foreignNames.name: ヘイヴングルの吸血鬼

cards.originalText:
Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.

cards.name: Heirs of Stromkirk
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever Heirs of Stromkirk deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever Heirs of Stromkirk deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Hound of Griselbrand
cards.text:
Double strike
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

foreignNames.name: グリセルブランドの猟犬

cards.originalText:
Double strike
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Kessig Malcontents
cards.text: When Kessig Malcontents enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of Humans you control.
cards.flavor: Discontent is a powerful weapon in the hands of a mob.

rulings.text: The number of Humans you control is counted when the enters-the-battlefield ability resolves.

cards.originalText: When Kessig Malcontents enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to the number of Humans you control.

cards.name: Kruin Striker
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Kruin Striker gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Unhappy with the creation of the wolfir, Rorica broke with her order and led a crusade against the "reformed werewolves."
cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Kruin Striker gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Mauler
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Lightning Mauler is paired with another creature, both creatures have haste.

rulings.text: A creature that loses haste after it's been declared as an attacking creature doesn't stop attacking.

cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Lightning Mauler is paired with another creature, both creatures have haste.

cards.name: Lightning Prowess
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste and "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor: "Undead flesh is dry and papery. A single spark and 'poof.' No more ghoul."
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste and "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Mad Prophet
cards.text:
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"

rulings.text: Discarding a card is part of the ability's activation cost. You can't activate the ability if you have no cards in hand.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

cards.name: Malicious Intent
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."
cards.flavor: As peace returned to Thraben, some cathars made the mistake of letting down their guard.

rulings.text: Once a creature has been declared as a blocking creature, making it unable to block will have no effect.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."

cards.name: Malignus
cards.text:
Malignus's power and toughness are each equal to half the highest life total among your opponents, rounded up.
Damage that would be dealt by Malignus can't be prevented.
cards.flavor: It descended on Estwald like a sudden storm. Moments later, only ashes and agony remained.

rulings.text: If Malignus becomes blocked by a creature with protection from red, the damage Malignus deals to that creature won't be prevented.

cards.originalText:
Malignus's power and toughness are each equal to half the highest life total among your opponents, rounded up.
Damage that would be dealt by Malignus can't be prevented.

cards.name: Pillar of Flame
cards.text: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: "May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion."

rulings.text: A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that dies this turn will be exiled even if it wasn't the target of Pillar of Flame (because the damage was redirected somehow). If the target creature isn't dealt damage (most likely because the damage was prevented), it won't be exiled if it dies that turn.
A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame will be exiled no matter why the creature would die that turn. It could have its toughness reduced to 0 or less or be destroyed by another spell or ability.

cards.originalText: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Raging Poltergeist
cards.flavor: Some tried cremating their dead to stop the ghoulcallers. But the dead returned, furious about their fate.

foreignNames.name: 怒れるポルターガイスト

cards.name: Reforge the Soul
cards.text:
Each player discards their hand, then draws seven cards.
Miracle {1}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)
cards.flavor: In a wave of spells called the Cursemute, Avacyn cleansed the world with divine fire.
cards.originalText:
Each player discards his or her hand and draws seven cards.
Miracle {1}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Riot Ringleader
cards.text: Whenever Riot Ringleader attacks, Human creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "So the vampires like hot blood, do they? Let's see how they handle ours."
cards.originalText: Whenever Riot Ringleader attacks, Human creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rite of Ruin
cards.text: Choose an order for artifacts, creatures, and lands. Each player sacrifices one permanent of the first type, sacrifices two of the second type, then sacrifices three of the third type.
cards.flavor: Skirsdag cultists refused to quietly accept Avacyn's ascendancy.

rulings.text: First you choose the order for the card types. Then each player in turn order (starting with the active player) chooses one permanent they control of the first card type. Then those permanents are sacrificed at the same time. Then each player in turn order chooses two permanents they control of the second card type. Then those permanents are sacrificed at the same time. Finally, each player in turn order chooses three permanents of the third card type, then those permanents are sacrificed at the same time.
Permanents sacrificed for one card type won't be on the battlefield to be chosen for subsequent card types.

If any abilities trigger while Rite of Ruin is resolving, those abilities will wait until Rite of Ruin finishes resolving before going on the stack. Starting with the active player, each player puts their abilities on the stack in any order.

cards.originalText: Choose an order for artifacts, creatures, and lands. Each player sacrifices one permanent of the first type, sacrifices two of the second type, then sacrifices three of the third type.

cards.name: Rush of Blood
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.
cards.flavor: Sometimes it's not for sustenance or to feed the dependence. Sometimes it's just to feel again.

rulings.text: The value of X is determined when Rush of Blood resolves. The bonus won't change later in the turn if the creature's power changes.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.

cards.name: Scalding Devil
cards.text: {2}{R}: Scalding Devil deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Demons massacre. Devils annoy.
cards.originalText: {2}{R}: Scalding Devil deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Somberwald Vigilante
cards.text: Whenever Somberwald Vigilante becomes blocked by a creature, Somberwald Vigilante deals 1 damage to that creature.
cards.flavor: He has nothing left but his resentment.

rulings.text: Somberwald Vigilante's ability will trigger for each creature it becomes blocked by.
The ability resolves before combat damage is dealt, so it could cause blocking creatures to be destroyed and thus not deal combat damage.

foreignNames.name: ソンバーワルドの自警団

cards.originalText: Whenever Somberwald Vigilante becomes blocked by a creature, Somberwald Vigilante deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Stonewright
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Stonewright is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Stonewright is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Thatcher Revolt
cards.text: Create three 1/1 red Human creature tokens with haste. Sacrifice those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The dark times left the peasantry ready to fight with whatever weapons were at hand.
cards.originalText: Put three 1/1 red Human creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield. Sacrifice those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Thunderbolt
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
• Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"My next aerial design will use less metal."
—Hadaken, alchemist of Nephalia
cards.originalText: Choose one — Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player; or Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Thunderous Wrath
cards.text:
Thunderous Wrath deals 5 damage to any target.
Miracle {R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)
cards.originalText:
Thunderous Wrath deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
Miracle {R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded
cards.text:
+1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.
−4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
−6: Gain control of all creatures until end of turn. Untap them. They gain haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: The number of cards in the target player's hand is determined when Tibalt's second ability resolves.
When Tibalt's third ability resolves, all creatures will become untapped and gain haste, including ones you controlled before the ability resolved.

foreignNames.name: 悪鬼の血統、ティボルト

cards.originalText:
+1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.
-4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
-6: Gain control of all creatures until end of turn. Untap them. They gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Tyrant of Discord
cards.text: When Tyrant of Discord enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a permanent they control at random and sacrifices it. If a nonland permanent is sacrificed this way, repeat this process.

rulings.text: Repeating the process includes the instruction to repeat the process. That is, the opponent will keep sacrificing permanents until they sacrifice a land.
Repeating the process does not include targeting an opponent. Only one opponent will have to sacrifice permanents.

If any abilities trigger while Tyrant of Discord's enters-the-battlefield ability is resolving, those abilities will wait until the enters-the-battlefield ability finishes resolving before going on the stack. Starting with the active player, each player puts their abilities on the stack in any order.

If the target opponent can't sacrifice permanents (perhaps because of Sigarda, Host of Herons), the opponent will choose a permanent at random but not sacrifice it. The ability will then finish resolving.

cards.originalText: When Tyrant of Discord enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a permanent he or she controls at random and sacrifices it. If a nonland permanent is sacrificed this way, repeat this process.

cards.name: Uncanny Speed
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"To survive, we must embrace the savagery we knew in our race's infancy."
—Edgar Markov
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Vexing Devil
cards.text: When Vexing Devil enters the battlefield, any opponent may have it deal 4 damage to them. If a player does, sacrifice Vexing Devil.
cards.flavor: It's not any fun until someone loses an eye.

rulings.text: If a player chooses to have Vexing Devil deal 4 damage to them, but some or all of that damage is prevented or redirected, Vexing Devil will still be sacrificed.

cards.originalText: When Vexing Devil enters the battlefield, any opponent may have it deal 4 damage to him or her. If a player does, sacrifice Vexing Devil.

cards.name: Vigilante Justice
cards.text: Whenever a Human enters the battlefield under your control, Vigilante Justice deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: It begins as a whisper and ends with the red roar of fire.
cards.originalText: Whenever a Human enters the battlefield under your control, Vigilante Justice deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Zealous Conscripts
cards.text:
Haste
When Zealous Conscripts enters the battlefield, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: The enters-the-battlefield ability can target any permanent, including one that's untapped or one that you already control.

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Zealous Conscripts enters the battlefield, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Abundant Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Abundant Growth enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."

rulings.text: The enchanted land retains any other abilities it has. Activating one of the land's activated abilities won't cause the other(s) to be activated.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
When Abundant Growth enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Blessings of Nature
cards.text:
Distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

rulings.text: You may choose up to four target creatures. You declare how many counters will be placed on each target creature as you cast Blessings of Nature. Each target must receive at least one counter.

cards.originalText:
Distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Borderland Ranger
cards.text: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "There's only one route from Kessig into Stensia. Unless you come with me."

foreignNames.name: 国境地帯のレインジャー

cards.originalText: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Bower Passage
cards.text: Creatures with flying can't block creatures you control.
cards.flavor: In the darkest hours, some denied Avacyn. Now the Kessig wilds are their only haven.

rulings.text: Bower Passage won't affect a blocking creature that gains flying after blockers are declared.
Creatures with reach can still block creatures you control.

cards.originalText: Creatures with flying can't block creatures you control.

cards.name: Champion of Lambholt
cards.text:
Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt's power can't block creatures you control.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of Lambholt.

rulings.text: Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt can't block any creature you control, not just Champion of Lambholt.
Champion of Lambholt's ability works even if it isn't attacking.

The comparison of power is only done when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Champion of Lambholt) after this point won't cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

cards.originalText:
Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt's power can't block creatures you control.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of Lambholt.

cards.name: Craterhoof Behemoth
cards.text:
Haste
When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: Its footsteps of today are the lakes of tomorrow.

rulings.text: The value of X is determined only as Craterhoof Behemoth's triggered ability resolves, potentially including Craterhoof Behemoth itself. It won't change later in the turn if the number of creatures you control changes.
Craterhoof Behemoth's triggered ability affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Descendants' Path
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.
If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.
If the revealed card is a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, but you choose not to cast it, it's put on the bottom of your library. (This is a recent change.)

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Diregraf Escort
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Diregraf Escort is paired with another creature, both creatures have protection from Zombies.

rulings.text: Diregraf Escort can be paired with a Zombie. The protection will have no effect on the pairing.

cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Diregraf Escort is paired with another creature, both creatures have protection from Zombies.

cards.name: Druid's Familiar
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Druid's Familiar is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +2/+2.

rulings.text: If Druid's Familiar becomes unpaired, it will immediately lose the +2/+2 bonus. If this causes it to have damage marked on it equal to it or greater than its new toughness, it will be destroyed. The same is true for the creature it was paired with.

cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Druid's Familiar is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Druids' Repository
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, put a charge counter on Druids' Repository.
Remove a charge counter from Druids' Repository: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability of Druids' Repository will trigger once for each creature you control that attacks.
You can activate the second ability of Druids' Repository multiple times in the same turn. It's a mana ability, doesn't use the stack, and can't be responded to.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, put a charge counter on Druids' Repository.
Remove a charge counter from Druids' Repository: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Eaten by Spiders
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying and all Equipment attached to that creature.
cards.flavor: After sampling many victims, the spider developed a preference for the undead and their accoutrements.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying and all Equipment attached to that creature.

cards.name: Flowering Lumberknot
cards.text: Flowering Lumberknot can't attack or block unless it's paired with a creature with soulbond.
cards.flavor:
"It used to eat us trappers. Now it follows us around like some kind of hound dog."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

rulings.text: Whether Flowering Lumberknot is paired is checked only when attackers or blockers are declared. After that point, Flowering Lumberknot becoming unpaired won't cause it to stop attacking or blocking.
If the creature Flowering Lumberknot is paired with loses soulbond, Flowering Lumberknot will remain paired but won't be able to attack or block.

cards.originalText: Flowering Lumberknot can't attack or block unless it's paired with a creature with soulbond.

cards.name: Geist Trappers
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Geist Trappers is paired with another creature, both creatures have reach.
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Geist Trappers is paired with another creature, both creatures have reach.

cards.name: Gloomwidow
cards.text:
Reach
Gloomwidow can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The abandoned towns on the moors didn't stay empty for long.
cards.originalText:
Reach
Gloomwidow can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Grounded
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses flying.
cards.flavor:
"We've tracked Ludevic's monster across four provinces. When it lands, make sure it stays put."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig,
to Halana of Ulvenwald

rulings.text: The creature can later gain flying from another effect. That will override Grounded's effect.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses flying.

cards.name: Howlgeist
cards.text:
Creatures with power less than Howlgeist's power can't block it.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

rulings.text: The comparison of power is performed only when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Howlgeist) after this point won't cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

cards.originalText:
Creatures with power less than Howlgeist's power can't block it.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Joint Assault
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's paired with a creature, that creature also gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"By my power, werewolves shall become the wolfir, our allies in combat against darkness."
—Avacyn's Cursemute Decree

rulings.text: Joint Assault targets only one creature. If that creature is an illegal target when Joint Assault tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No creature will get +2/+2.

Joint Assault checks whether the target creature is paired only when it resolves. If it becomes unpaired later in the turn, neither creature will lose the bonus. Similarly, if it becomes paired later in the turn, the creature it's paired with won't gain the bonus.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's paired with a creature, that creature also gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lair Delve
cards.text: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all creature and land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: "The fiends have fled. Well, good riddance. Nothing I like more than an empty lair."
cards.originalText: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all creature and land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Natural End
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: The haunted blade shattered, and the geist drifted gratefully to the Blessed Sleep.

rulings.text: If the artifact or enchantment is an illegal target when Natural End tries to resolve, Natural End won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Nettle Swine
cards.flavor:
"I killed one and found bricks and bones in its belly. It had eaten a whole cottage, thatch and all."
—Paulin, Somberwald trapper

cards.name: Nightshade Peddler
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Nightshade Peddler is paired with another creature, both creatures have deathtouch.
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Nightshade Peddler is paired with another creature, both creatures have deathtouch.

cards.name: Pathbreaker Wurm
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Pathbreaker Wurm is paired with another creature, both creatures have trample.
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Pathbreaker Wurm is paired with another creature, both creatures have trample.

cards.name: Primal Surge
cards.text: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you do, repeat this process.
cards.flavor: With Avacyn's return, the flow of life became a tidal wave.

rulings.text: A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.

Repeating the process includes the instruction to repeat the process. That is, you'll keep exiling cards and putting them onto the battlefield until you fail to put a permanent card onto the battlefield.

If you exile a permanent card that you can't put onto the battlefield (such as an Aura with nothing legal to enchant) or one you don't want to put onto the battlefield, Primal Surge finishes resolving.

If putting any of those permanent cards onto the battlefield causes abilities to trigger, those abilities will wait to go on the stack until Primal Surge has finished resolving. Starting with the active player, each player puts their abilities on the stack in any order.

cards.originalText: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you do, repeat this process.

cards.name: Rain of Thorns
cards.text:
Choose one or more —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: When the forests became havens for evil, the archmages devised new ways to cleanse the wilds.

rulings.text: You can choose just one mode, any two of the modes, or all three. You make this choice as you cast Rain of Thorns.

cards.originalText: Choose one or more — Destroy target artifact; destroy target enchantment; and/or destroy target land.

cards.name: Revenge of the Hunted
cards.text:
Until end of turn, target creature gets +6/+6 and gains trample, and all creatures able to block it this turn do so.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)
cards.originalText:
Until end of turn, target creature gets +6/+6 and gains trample, and all creatures able to block it this turn do so.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Sheltering Word
cards.text: Target creature you control gains hexproof until end of turn. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (A creature with hexproof can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

rulings.text: If a creature gains hexproof in response to a spell or ability controlled by an opponent that targets only it, that spell or ability doesn't resolve for having an illegal target when it tries to resolve.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control gains hexproof until end of turn. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (A creature with hexproof can't be the target of spells or abilities opponents control.)

cards.name: Snare the Skies
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: A hunter's precision and a durkvine's strength are a potent combination.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Somberwald Sage
cards.text: {T}: Add three mana of any one color. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.
cards.flavor: "You can face any danger when all of nature is on your side."

rulings.text: Mana produced by Somberwald Sage can be spent on any part of a creature spell's total cost. This includes additional costs (such as kicker) and alternative costs (such as evoke costs).
Mana produced by Somberwald Sage can't be spent on activated abilities, even ones that put a creature card directly onto the battlefield, such as unearth or ninjutsu.
Mana produced by Somberwald Sage can't be spent on noncreature spells that would put creature tokens onto the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: ソンバーワルドの賢者

cards.originalText: {T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

cards.name: Soul of the Harvest
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: It's there when a seed sprouts, when gourds ripen on the vines, and when the reapers cut the grains under the Harvest Moon.

rulings.text: A creature card that enters the battlefield as a copy of a token creature is still a nontoken creature. You'll be able to draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Terrifying Presence
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by creatures other than target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Elmut had slaughtered vampires, slain werewolves, and destroyed hordes of zombies. Sadly, he never got over his fear of spiders.

rulings.text: Although Terrifying Presence doesn't affect the target creature, if that creature is an illegal target when Terrifying Presence tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be prevented.

cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by creatures other than target creature this turn.

cards.name: Timberland Guide
cards.text: When Timberland Guide enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: "Can you build a fire? Track a deer? Identify killer trees? Then you'll never survive Kessig without me."

rulings.text: You may choose Timberland Guide as the target of its own ability.

cards.originalText: When Timberland Guide enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Triumph of Ferocity
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.
cards.flavor:
"Rid me of this curse, witch, or die with me."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

rulings.text: Triumph of Ferocity's ability will trigger at the beginning of each of your upkeeps regardless of who controls the creature with the greatest power. The ability checks whether you'll draw a card when it resolves.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

cards.name: Trusted Forcemage
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Trusted Forcemage is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +1/+1.
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Trusted Forcemage is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Ulvenwald Tracker
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature you control fights another target creature.
cards.flavor: "Peace will come to Innistrad, but only after all abominations have been dealt with, one by one."

rulings.text: The second target of Ulvenwald Tracker's ability can be another creature you control, but it can't be the same creature as the first target.
If either target of Ulvenwald Tracker's ability is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, neither creature will deal or be dealt damage.

foreignNames.name: ウルヴェンワルドの足跡追い

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature you control fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Vorstclaw
cards.flavor:
"Where'd the werewolves go? Maybe that got hungry."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

cards.name: Wandering Wolf
cards.text: Creatures with power less than Wandering Wolf's power can't block it.
cards.flavor: Humans still feared wolves, though no connection between them and the curse of lycanthropy had ever been proved.

rulings.text: The comparison of power is only done when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Wandering Wolf) after this point won't cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

cards.originalText: Creatures with power less than Wandering Wolf's power can't block it.

cards.name: Wild Defiance
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control becomes the target of an instant or sorcery spell, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When civilization reaches out its greedy hand, take it off at the wrist."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

rulings.text: Wild Defiance's ability will resolve before that instant or sorcery spell.
If an instant or sorcery spell targets the same creature you control more than once, Wild Defiance will trigger only once.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control becomes the target of an instant or sorcery spell, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wildwood Geist
cards.text: Wildwood Geist gets +2/+2 as long as it's your turn.
cards.flavor: The geists that dwell in the deep forests of Kessig are as untamable as the woods themselves.
cards.originalText: Wildwood Geist gets +2/+2 as long as it's your turn.

cards.name: Wolfir Avenger
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Wolfir Avenger.
cards.flavor: Released from a dark curse and bound to a higher calling.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Wolfir Avenger.

cards.name: Wolfir Silverheart
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Wolfir Silverheart is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +4/+4.
cards.originalText:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Wolfir Silverheart is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +4/+4.

cards.name: Yew Spirit
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}: Yew Spirit gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.
cards.flavor:
"I wonder what dwelled in the primordial forests before humans existed."
—Elder Rimheit

rulings.text: The value of X is determined when the ability resolves. The bonus won't change later in the turn if the creature's power changes.
If this creature's power is negative as its ability resolves, X is considered to be 0. (This is a change from previous rulings.)

cards.originalText: {2}{G}{G}: Yew Spirit gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

cards.name: Bruna, Light of Alabaster
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever Bruna, Light of Alabaster attacks or blocks, you may attach to it any number of Auras on the battlefield and you may put onto the battlefield attached to it any number of Aura cards that could enchant it from your graveyard and/or hand.

rulings.text: Only Auras that could legally enchant Bruna may be attached to it, whether they're being moved from other permanents or being put onto the battlefield. An Aura with "enchant land," for example, could not be attached to Bruna this way.
All of these Auras will become attached to Bruna before combat damage is dealt. If Bruna is attacking, these Auras become attached before blockers are declared.

foreignNames.name: 雪花石を率いる者、ブルーナ

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever Bruna, Light of Alabaster attacks or blocks, you may attach to it any number of Auras on the battlefield and you may put onto the battlefield attached to it any number of Aura cards that could enchant it from your graveyard and/or hand.

cards.name: Gisela, Blade of Goldnight
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
If a source would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, that source deals double that damage to that player or permanent instead.
If a source would deal damage to you or a permanent you control, prevent half that damage, rounded up.

rulings.text: Gisela doubles damage dealt to opponents and permanents your opponents control from any source, including sources controlled by those opponents.

If multiple replacement effects would modify how damage would be dealt, the player being dealt damage (or the controller of the permanent being dealt damage) chooses the order in which to apply those effects.

If damage dealt by a source you control is being divided or assigned among multiple permanents an opponent controls or among an opponent and one or more permanents they control simultaneously, divide the original amount and double the results. For example, if you attack with a 5/5 creature with trample and your opponent blocks with a 2/2 creature, you can assign 2 damage to the blocker and 3 damage to the defending player. These amounts are then doubled to 4 and 6 damage, respectively. You can't double the damage to 10 first and then assign 2 to the creature and 8 to the player.

foreignNames.name: Gisela, Espada de la Noche Dorada

cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
If a source would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, that source deals double that damage to that player or permanent instead.
If a source would deal damage to you or a permanent you control, prevent half that damage, rounded up.

cards.name: Sigarda, Host of Herons
cards.text:
Flying, hexproof
Spells and abilities your opponents control can't cause you to sacrifice permanents.
cards.flavor: Great devotion yields great reward.

rulings.text: As a spell or ability an opponent controls resolves, if it would force you to sacrifice a permanent, you just don't. That part of the effect does nothing. If that spell or ability gives you the option to sacrifice a permanent (as Brain Gorger's ability does), you can't take that option.

If a spell or ability an opponent controls instructs you to perform an action unless you sacrifice a permanent (as Ogre Marauder does), you can't choose to sacrifice a permanent. You must perform the action. On the other hand, if a spell or ability an opponent controls instructs you to sacrifice a permanent unless you perform an action (as Killing Wave does), you can choose whether or not to perform the action. If you don't perform the action, nothing happens, since you can't sacrifice any permanents.
You may still sacrifice permanents to pay the costs of spells you cast and abilities you activate, or because a resolving spell or ability you control instructs or allows you to do so.
You may sacrifice a permanent to pay the activation cost of an ability, even if that ability comes from a permanent an opponent controls (such as Excavation).

You may sacrifice a permanent as a special action, even if the effect that allows you to do so comes from an opponent's permanent (such as Damping Engine or Volrath's Curse). No one controls special actions.

This ability affects only sacrifices. It won't stop a creature from being put into the graveyard due to lethal damage or having 0 toughness, and it won't stop a permanent from being put into the graveyard due to the "legend rule." None of these are sacrifices; they're the result of game rules.

foreignNames.name: Sigarda de la Milice des hérons

cards.originalText:
Flying, hexproof
Spells and abilities your opponents control can't cause you to sacrifice permanents.

cards.name: Angel's Tomb
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Angel's Tomb become a 3/3 white Angel artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Faith can quicken the stones themselves with life."
—Writings of Mikaeus

rulings.text: If Angel's Tomb is already a creature when a creature enters the battlefield under your control, its ability will override any effects that set its base power and toughness to specific values, but other changes to its power and toughness (such as the one created by Titanic Growth) will still apply.

Effects setting Angel's Tomb's base power and toughness to specific values that begin to apply after Angel's Tomb has become a creature will override the effect of Angel's Tomb. For example, if an effect causes a 3/3 Angel's Tomb to become 0/1, it will remain 0/1 until another effect (such as triggering the ability of Angel's Tomb a second time or targeting it with Titanic Growth) causes those values to change.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Angel's Tomb become a 3/3 white Angel artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Angelic Armaments
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and is a white Angel in addition to its other colors and types.
Equip {4}
cards.flavor: Forged in dark hours from the flame that would not die.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and is a white Angel in addition to its other colors and types.
Equip {4}

cards.name: Bladed Bracers
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
As long as equipped creature is a Human or an Angel, it has vigilance.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Forged from the rubble of the Helvault.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
As long as equipped creature is a Human or an Angel, it has vigilance.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Conjurer's Closet
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."
—Kordel the Cryptic
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Gallows at Willow Hill
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Tap three untapped Humans you control: Destroy target creature. Its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

rulings.text: You can tap any three untapped Humans you control, including ones you haven't controlled continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn, to pay the cost of the activated ability.

If the targeted creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, the ability won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The creature's controller won't put a Spirit token onto the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Gibet de la Colline des Saules
Cadalso de la Colina del Sauce

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}, Tap three untapped Humans you control: Destroy target creature. Its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Drain the victim's blood, sell the corpse, and use the soul on guard duty. No muss, no fuss, no problems."
—Olivia Voldaren

cards.name: Moonsilver Spear
Narstad Scrapper
cards.text: {2}: Narstad Scrapper gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

foreignNames.name: ナースタードの潰し屋

cards.name: Otherworld Atlas
cards.text:
{T}: Put a charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.
{T}: Each player draws a card for each charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.
cards.flavor:
"Any fool can open it. But it takes a genius to decipher the blank pages."
—Kordel the Cryptic
cards.originalText:
{T}: Put a charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.
{T}: Each player draws a card for each charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.

cards.name: Scroll of Avacyn
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Avacyn: Draw a card. If you control an Angel, you gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: Words to bless the eye that reads them, telling of a future beyond the reach of fear.

rulings.text: Whether you control an Angel is checked when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Avacyn: Draw a card. If you control an Angel, you gain 5 life.

cards.name: Scroll of Griselbrand
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Griselbrand: Target opponent discards a card. If you control a Demon, that player loses 3 life.
cards.flavor: Words no eyes should see, telling of things no sane mind could fathom.

rulings.text: Whether you control a Demon is checked when the ability resolves.

foreignNames.name: グリセルブランドの巻物

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Griselbrand: Target opponent discards a card. If you control a Demon, that player loses 3 life.

cards.name: Tormentor's Trident
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and attacks each combat if able.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor: To a demon there is no such thing as restraint.

rulings.text: You still decide which player or planeswalker the equipped creature attacks.

If, during your declare attackers step, the equipped creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under your control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, you're not forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and attacks each turn if able.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Vanguard's Shield
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +0/+3 and can block an additional creature each combat.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Wars are not fought on a single front.

rulings.text: Abilities that allow a creature to block an additional creature are cumulative.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +0/+3 and can block an additional creature.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Vessel of Endless Rest
cards.text:
When Vessel of Endless Rest enters the battlefield, put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
When Vessel of Endless Rest enters the battlefield, put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Alchemist's Refuge
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{G}{U}, {T}: You may cast spells this turn as though they had flash.
cards.flavor: Persecuted alchemists fled deep into Kessig's wilds, seeking solitude to continue their ghoulish craft.

rulings.text: You can cast a nonland card with flash any time you could cast an instant.
The last ability applies to nonland cards in any zone, provided something is allowing you to cast them. For example, you could cast a sorcery with flashback as though it had flash.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{G}{U}, {T}: You may cast nonland cards this turn as though they had flash.

cards.name: Cavern of Souls
cards.text:
As Cavern of Souls enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell of the chosen type, and that spell can't be countered.

rulings.text: You must choose an existing creature type, such as Zombie or Warrior. Card types such as artifact can't be chosen.

The spell can't be countered if the mana produced by Cavern of Souls is spent to cover any cost of the spell, even an additional cost such as a kicker cost. This is true even if you use the mana to pay an additional cost while casting a spell "without paying its mana cost."

cards.originalText:
As Cavern of Souls enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell of the chosen type, and that spell can't be countered.

cards.name: Desolate Lighthouse
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}{U}{R}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
